channel.title: Problems Un-Installing Microsoft Office Home and Student Edition 2007
channel.description:
Hey, guys. I haven't been here for quite a while. Anyway, I got a brand new laptop for Christmas with Windows Vista and it came with a free 30-day trial of Microsoft Office Home and Student Edition 2007. Now, I looked on quite a few websites for product keys and found quite a few. It said that they worked but they didn't so I tried to do this thing where you change something on the "proof.en" file and I ended up deleting the whole thing :( So now, I can't un-install the damn thing and when I do try it says: "The language of this installation package is not supported by your system" I NEED to get rid of it. How do I un-install it without fucking my laptop up?
Regards, Nick. ;)

item.title: Problems Un-Installing Microsoft Office Home and Student Edition 2007
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“NickMoran06, post:4, topic:182825”][quote author=souljah link=topic=244509.msg2064356#msg2064356 date=1203406390]
I had the exact same problem, Try deleting all the program files first and Use Ccleaner to delete it from the list. Not sure if that works, I cant remember how I got rid of my trials.
[/quote]
That seems to work. Thanks.[/quote]
Thats good that you got it, and also look for “blue edition” if you want it full enterprise style. Can’t post any links
Nice sig btw!

Read full topic
item.source: Problems Un-Installing Microsoft Office Home and Student Edition 2007

item.title: Problems Un-Installing Microsoft Office Home and Student Edition 2007
item.dc:creator: @NickMoran06 NickMoran06
item.description:
@NickMoran06 wrote:

souljah:

I had the exact same problem, Try deleting all the program files first and Use Ccleaner to delete it from the list. Not sure if that works, I cant remember how I got rid of my trials.

That seems to work. Thanks.

Read full topic
